frame.name: Be_in_control
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> is in conscious control over a <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>, <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Controlling_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>A thing or person whose behavior controls a <fen>Dependent_situation</fen>, <fen>Dependent_variable</fen>, or <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by an Controlling_entity or an Controlling_situation.</def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_situation
FE.definition: <def-root>A situation that whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by an Controlling_entity, Controlling_event, or Controlling_variable.</def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_variable
FE.definition:
<def-root>A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of an Influencing_entity, a Influencing_variable, or an Influencing_situation.
<ex>Move the slider on the SpeedBar while playing audio or video material to <t>control</t> <fex name="depv">playback speed</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Degree to which the <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> effects the <fen>Dependent_entity</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the controlling occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location at which the controlling occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Controlling_entity</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: control.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the power to influence people's behaviour or the course of events.
